title.narrative: WASH OP 1 - POLICY AND CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By the end of 2020, the government demonstrates increased political commitment and capacity to legislate, plan, budget, coordinate, deliver, monitor and evaluate Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions at scale at national and sub-national levels., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2020, households and communities have access to safe drinking water, sanitation, and healthy environments and good hygiene practices are equitably improved in target regions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2020, the government demonstrates increased political commitment and capacity to legislate, plan, budget,coordinate, deliver, monitor and evaluate WASH interventions at scale at national and sub-national levels.

description.narrative: Despite the pandemic, UNICEF continued;to provide support to the;Government;to;improve;the;WASH sector Enabling Environment. Major achievements;include;enabling Madagascar to attend the Finance Minister’s virtual;Sanitation and Water for All (SWA);meeting for Africa. Equally, the;National WASH policy, the;National;Water;Quality;analysis, the;National WASH and Nutrition;Strategy were finalised during 2020.;Finally, the WASH;“TrackFin”;initiative;for monitoring financial allocations;has been launched under the leadership;of the ministry in charge of WASH,;UNICEF,;and other WASH Development partners.; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:12/01/2021
